Key Match Events: Baris Yilmaz was sent off for a second yellow card after a late tackle on Neco Williams
Joe Rodon missed a header over the bar for Wales
Aaron Ramsey went close to converting Sorba Thomas's low corner
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy expressed confidence in his team’s future performance, stating, 'This is the worst we're going to be. The more we learn, the more time we spend together, learning the finer details, there's way more to come.'
Post-Match Reflections: Bellamy reflected on the team's performance, saying, 'It was great. But I'm not a master of this after one game, trust me.'
Turkey manager Vincenzo Montella blamed the physical toll of the summer tournament on his team’s poor performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sorba Thomas shone on his first appearance since March last year and his first start since June 2022
Turkey played more than 35 minutes with 10 men after Baris Yilmaz was sent off
Ben Fisher noted the entertaining nature of the draw for Welsh supporters, calling it 'the worst we're going to be'
